item.name: Domestic Monetary Policy and Technology Subcommittee

item.title: A bill to award a congressional gold medal to Lord Robertson of Port Ellen.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

item.name: Domestic Monetary Policy and Technology Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Domestic and International Monetary Policy, Trade, and Technology.
Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.fullName: Del. Faleomavaega, Eni F. H. [D-AS-At Large]

summary.text: Directs the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the President Pro Tempore of the Senate to arrange for the presentation of a congressional gold medal to Lord Robertson of Port Ellen (Secretary General of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization) in recognition of his contributions to maintaining the security of the Euro-Atlantic region.

bill.title: To award a congressional gold medal to Lord Robertson of Port Ellen.

item.title: To award a congressional gold medal to Lord Robertson of Port Ellen.
To award a congressional gold medal to Lord Robertson of Port Ellen.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Domestic and International Monetary Policy, Trade, and Technology.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
